snippet: When, after seven months in jail, Fabian Cervantes walked into a church where he had worshiped and toiled, his best friend in the congregation considered it a miracle.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column describes uplifting story of Fabian Cervantes, illegal immigrant who helped repair 37 rows of pews at Roman Catholic church Our Lady of Refuge in Brooklyn; notes Cervantes was jailed and nearly deported for driving without a license, but was miraculously released under discretion given to court by Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: When, after seven months in jail, Fabian Cervantes walked into a church where he had worshiped and toiled, his best friend in the congregation considered it a miracle.

headline.print_headline: Pews Tirelessly Restored, and an Immigrant Redeemed
